instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not powering on, orange light on charger, no liquid
threads.message:
Hi. I am new to Macbook logic repair and am trying to get a Macbook Air to power on. 

Charger goes from green to orange, no liquid damage. I thought older Macbooks had a green light if the battery wasn't plugged in. Anyway, here are some measurements I took, 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C3080</CAPACITOR> 8,57v

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> @ <RESISTOR>R7202</RESISTOR> 8.59v

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C7500</CAPACITOR> 8.59v

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> @ <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> 15.15v

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> 3.98v

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C5006</CAPACITOR> 3.42v

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR> 3.32v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C7505</CAPACITOR> 5v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C4690</CAPACITOR> Goes to .9v then to 0v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C3550</CAPACITOR> 3.3v

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> @ Pin 5 <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> 3.39v  
  I am not sure where to go from here. I haven't tested a known DC board but have one coming in early next week. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not powering on, orange light on charger, no liquid
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C4690</CAPACITOR> Goes to .9v then to 0v

So the board is probably power cycling. Was this liquid damage? History?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not powering on, orange light on charger, no liquid
threads.message: No liquid damage. Just decided to not power on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not powering on, orange light on charger, no liquid
threads.message: CPU VCore pulsing as well? If no, check all rails for shorts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not powering on, orange light on charger, no liquid
threads.message: Vcore is pulsing as well at L7310

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not powering on, orange light on charger, no liquid
threads.message: If this is 100% no liquid and 100% no drop and 100% not fucked with then the BIOS is the first thing to try at this point.
